1.title: Laverock Hill Estate
1.plot: The Salvage Dawgs go to Glenside, PA, to salvage columns, doors, mantles, bathtubs and more from a sprawling 1918 mansion.

2.title: Twin Capes Ferry
2.plot: The crew goes to Norfolk, VA, to salvage an obsolete ferry's lights, skylights, a mural and more. Later, Grayson helps Mike and Tay with a commissioned build for a fellow maker.

3.title: Country Store and Gas Station
3.plot: The team uses materials from a demolished country store in Grottoes, VA, to create a tribute bench for a veterans' retreat.

1.title: Izard House
1.plot: Robert Kulp, Mike Whiteside and the Black Dog crew salvage the Izard House - a two-room cabin built in the late 1892. The team removes a box bay window in one piece, a Dixie Oak stove, a stairwell and old poplar wood.

2.title: Washington Mills
2.plot: Mike Whiteside, Robert Kulp and the Black Dog crew salvage the Washington Mill, an old cotton mill from the late 1800s. They find wooden louvers, open wire baskets and an old barber chair.

3.title: Robert E. Lee Hotel
3.plot: Robert Kulp, Mike Whiteside and the Black Dog crew salvage the Robert E. Lee Hotel, a six-story luxury hotel built in 1926 in Lexington, VA. Key finds include a peg leg sink, French doors and pelican urinals.

4.title: Bent Mountain Mill
4.plot: Robert Kulp, Mike Whiteside and the Black Dog crew salvage the Bent Mountain Mill, a grist mill used for grinding wheat and other grains. Key finds include patina doors, mill stones and running gears.

5.title: James House
5.plot: Robert Kulp, Mike Whiteside and the Black Dog crew salvage the James House, a 5,000 square foot home built in 1893. The team removes a hand-crafted Carrara marble mantle, a cast iron sink, vintage cabinet and historical negatives.

6.title: Ghent Row
6.plot: Mike Whiteside, Robert Kulp and the Black Dog Salvage crew tackle an entire city block of Victorian houses in Norfolk, VA. One of which is The Painted Lady, an old tearoom originally built in 1892 and renovated in 1997.

7.title: Smith Mountain Lake
7.plot: Mike Whiteside, Robert Kulp and the Black Dog crew salvage wood from a cabin at Smith Mountain Lake. From that wood, Mike builds a four-post bed to sell in the shop.

8.title: Former First Baptist Church
8.plot: Mike Whiteside, Robert Kulp and the Black Dog Salvage crew save parts from the former First Baptist Church in Bluefield, WV. Key finds include accordion doors, a pipe organ, and a balcony.

9.title: Homestead Stables
9.plot: Mike Whiteside, Robert Kulp and the Black Dog crew tackle the Homestead Stables and carriage house in Hot Springs, VA. Key finds include stable doors, a carriage, trusses, and a hand-operated carriage elevator.

10.title: Foursquare Church
10.plot: Mike, Robert and the Black Dog Salvage crew take on extracting large and fragile stained glass windows at a church in Salisbury, NC. The guys also pick through a local piano store for some interesting finds.

11.title: Post-War Colonial Revival Home
11.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage crew salvage a house from the 1940's in Washington, DC. Key items include a large conservatory, bottle glass windows, and dark room supplies.

12.title: American Foursquare House
12.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage crew tackle an American Foursquare house from 1910 in Fairmont, West Virginia. Key finds include huge built-in cabinets, mahogany wainscoting, and a porcelain tub.

13.title: Stick Style House
13.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage crew salvage an extremely dirty house in Knoxville, TN. Key finds include some East Lake hardware, mantles, surround tiles, and front porch columns.

1.title: Nestlebrooke
1.plot: The Black Dog Salvage crew pitches in to help save parts of a house in Roanoke, VA. Main items include floors, trim, front porch columns, and a built in cabinet. While salvaging, Mike and Robert also search for buried treasure.

2.title: Northeast Farmhouse
2.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage crew save parts of an early 1800s farmhouse and barn in Edison, NJ. Key items include corner plinths, thick floorboards, and an elaborate front entryway.

3.title: Eiffel Tower Replica
3.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage guys disassemble a 40 foot Eiffel Tower replica in Columbus, OH. While in Columbus, they pick through a fellow salvager's collection. Grayson builds a floor lamp back at the warehouse.

4.title: Hill Crest Bed & Breakfast
4.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage crew extract a fireclay tub and window frame from a bed and breakfast. The crew picks through a large auto graveyard. Key finds include a fire truck, a vintage cooler and PBR sign.

5.title: Lakeside Marina
5.plot: Mike, Robert, and the Black Dog Salvage crew travel to Smith Mountain Lake to save parts off a sinking boat. While at the marina, they discover other boats on the property to salvage.

6.title: Spiral Staircase
6.plot: The Black Dog Salvage crew splits up for the week. Robert and Grayson salvage a spiral staircase in Norfolk, while Mike and the guys pick through a restoration shop in Petersburg.

7.title: Foursquare Farmhouse
7.plot: Hosts Mike and Robert salvage a foursquare house in Roanoke. Mike builds a tailgater grill unit.

8.title: Bunker-Ramo Teletrade
8.plot: The Dawgs remove a teletrade from a brokerage firm. They also pick through a barn in Ohio.

9.title: USS Zuni/USCG Tamaroa
9.plot: Hosts Mike and Robert salvage parts off an old navy ship. Mike builds a table from an airplane wing.

10.title: Thomas Massie Orchard
10.plot: Mike and Robert salvage parts of an old apple orchard. Robert helps with an iron gate.

11.title: Conrail Caboose
11.plot: Mike and Robert salvage parts from a train caboose. The crew picks through the Old Cold Storage.

12.title: Sheridan Square Theatre Facade
12.plot: The Black Dog crew tackles a theater façade in Ohio. Mike builds a bed frame from horse jump poles.

13.title: Youngwood High School
13.plot: Mike Whiteside, Robert Kulp and the Black Dog Salvage crew save parts from a 1917 high school up in Youngwood, PA. Key finds include lockers, chalkboards, sinks, and a gothic window transom.

1.title: Nelson House
1.plot: The Black Dog Salvage crew saves pieces of a house in Mt. Jackson, VA. Their main focus is on the clay-fired roof and on the oversized cornice brackets. Back in the wood shop, Mike makes a bench from an old dresser.

2.title: Old Stage Coach Inn
2.plot: Mike and Robert salvage a house previously damaged by a tornado near Abingdon, VA. Key items include floors, doors and a complete staircase. While at the warehouse, Mike makes a commissioned desk from a balance beam.

3.title: Reel Theatres
3.plot: Mike, Robert and the team salvage a movie theater in Sevierville, TN. Key items include analog projectors, movie screens, and neon letters. Mike also builds a commissioned table from a window frame.

4.title: St. Mary's Church Rectory
4.plot: The Black Dog crew salvages St. Mary's Church in Chillicothe, OH. Key items include cast-iron mantles, a large built-in cabinet and a stained-glass front doorway. At the shop, Tay and his dad work to make a truck from a VW bus.

5.title: Bowman House
5.plot: Mike, Robert and the Black Dog crew salvage an early 1800s farmhouse in Mt. Jackson, VA. Key items include pocket doors, a primitive armoire and heart pine flooring. Grayson brings a new idea to Mike to make a bench from 3 chairs.

6.title: Nehi Bottling Plant
6.plot: Mike salvages large industrial doors from the old Nehi Bottling Plant in Covington, VA. Back at the shop, Robert and Tay work on a gate made from a bicycle. The guys also pick through a collection brought in by a local vendor.

7.title: Byrd Log Cabin
7.plot: The Salvage Dawgs team returns to a previously salvaged house to save its original log structure. Mike and Tay learn how that wood is milled for a custom building project. Mike builds an end table for the property owner.

8.title: Meek Farmhouse
8.plot: Mike and Robert remove a two-piece staircase from a farmhouse in Marion, VA. The guys also pick through a train yard. Back at the shop, Mike builds a bar from panel doors as a surprise for a customer's husband.

9.title: Hylton Victorian
9.plot: Black Dog Salvage saves parts of an old Victorian-style farmhouse in Laurel Forks, VA. Mike and Robert learn how to hand throw bricks at the Old Virginia Brick Company. Tay transforms a busted up VW bus into a flatbed truck.

10.title: Roanoke College
10.plot: Black Dog Salvage saves architectural elements at Roanoke College in Salem, VA. Key items include railings, brick pavers, gothic lighting, and a safe from the 1940s. Mike and Courtney repurpose a mantle into a hanging wall piece.

11.title: Weatherford Farmhouse
11.plot: Salvage Dawgs save parts of a farmhouse in South Boston, VA. Key items include chairs, milk-painted paneling, and an arched window. Mike and Robert get to pick through some of the owner's personal collections.

12.title: Fringer Cannery
12.plot: Mike, Robert and the crew salvage an old iron ore mine that was converted into a cannery in the 1930s. Main items include a curved I-beam, oversized pressure-cookers, and a canning carousel.

13.title: St. Andrews Church Spires
13.plot: The Dawgs help save copper elements from the St. Andrews Catholic Church spires in Roanoke, VA. The guys also bring in an expert to learn more about a large lithograph from a previous salvage.

1.title: Vicksburg Iron Arch
1.plot: The team salvages an iron storefront. Mike builds a table for country music duo Thompson Square.

2.title: Geyser Gulch
2.plot: The Dawgs salvage Geyser Gulch at Silver Dollar City. Mike builds a hostess stand for a restaurant.

3.title: Bemis Cotton Mill
3.plot: The Dawgs salvage the Bemis Cotton Mill in Jackson, Tennessee. Mike builds a bookshelf using the panels from a door at the warehouse.

4.title: Old Robeson County Jail
4.plot: The Dawgs salvage a 1950s jail in Lumberton, North Carolina. Mike and Tay build a bar from a bowling alley floor at the shop.

5.title: Clapp Windmill
5.plot: The Dawgs salvage an Aeromotor windmill in Liberty, North Carolina. Back in the woodshop, Mike uses salvaged barn wood and iron to build a floor lamp.

6.title: Elks National Home
6.plot: The Dawgs salvage parts of the Elks National Home in Bedford, Virginia. Back in the woodshop, Mike builds a swing from a salvaged apple crate and upholsters cushions from old postal bags.

7.title: Terracotta Silo
7.plot: The Dawgs struggle to take down a terracotta silo in Bedford, Virginia. Back at the shop, Mike builds a coffee table from an old factory cart.

8.title: Return to Geyser Gulch
8.plot: The Dawgs return to Geyser Gulch at Silver Dollar City in Branson, Missouri. Back at the warehouse, Mike builds a garden arbor out of two doors.

9.title: P.A. Denny Riverboat
9.plot: The Salvage Dawgs save a calliope from a riverboat in Parkersburg, West Virginia. Courtney collaborates with Mike to build a mirror from pieces of wall trim at the shop.

10.title: Wheeling Appartment
10.plot: The Dawgs salvage elements from an apartment building in Wheeling, West Virginia. Mike builds a wine tasting table from an old lamppost and barrel staves at Black Dog Salvage.

11.title: American Viscose Plant
11.plot: The Dawgs save a kiln from the American Viscose Plant in Roanoke, Virginia. Mike and Tay work together to build custom tables for a local optometrist office.

12.title: Tully Choice Cabin
12.plot: The Dawgs save steps and chimney rocks from a 1765 log cabin at Smith Mountain Lake. Gracie takes the team to a local glass blowing artist to make pieces for a chandelier. Robert and Ted also pick through a barn.

13.title: Scott Boulevard Baptist Church
13.plot: The Dawgs travel to Decatur, Georgia, to salvage the Scott Boulevard Baptist Church. Back at the shop, Mike and Tay build an iron console.

1.title: Drayton Mill
1.plot: The guys travel to Drayton Mill, a former textile factory in Spartenburg, SC. Key salvaged items include a large fan and valves. Mike also builds a new desk for his office out of a old airplane wing.

2.title: Former First National Bank
2.plot: The Salvage Dawgs take on the former first National Bank in Gastonia, NC. Key items salvaged include elevator parts and chicken wire windows. At the shop, Robert builds a bar out of a boat salvaged from Smith Mountain Lake.

3.title: Covington Church
3.plot: The Salvage Dawgs work on Covington church and find tambour doors, stairs and a jukebox. Mike and Tay build a locker bench, then the crew finds a propane spotlight.

4.title: Rising Sun Ranch
4.plot: The Dawgs tackle a ranch house in Alderson, West Virginia. Key items salvaged include stained glass and corbels. In the shop, Mike reuses timber to build a beam table.

5.title: Trenton Central High School
5.plot: The Salvage Dawgs team takes on a huge high school in Trenton, NJ. Key items found include fireclay sinks and oak cabinets. Mike and Tay build an N-shaped desk in the shop.

6.title: Portside Marina
6.plot: The Dawgs save the bow and stern of a boat on Smith Mountain Lake in Moneta, VA. The team cuts up an old Chevy van for a commissioned wall art piece. New dogs Molly May and Stella make their debut.

7.title: Return to Trenton High School
7.plot: The Dawgs return to Trenton Central High School in Trenton, NJ. Key items found include four large clock faces and library ladders. In the shop, Mike and Tay build a table from an old jail bed.

8.title: Reed Creek Mill
8.plot: The Dawgs salvage the Reed Creek Mill in Wytheville, VA. Key items found include conveyor belts and a flour hopper. Mike also builds a console for his nephew.

9.title: Wilberger Funeral Home
9.plot: The Salvage Dawgs team saves parts of the Wilberger Funeral Home in New Hope, VA. Key items salvaged include an elevator and barn door hardware. Back in Roanoke, Mike and the guys build a collapsible bookcase.

10.title: Mt. Vernon Greek Revival
10.plot: The Salvage Dawgs save as much as they can from a burnt-down house in Mt. Vernon, OH. In the shop, Mike builds a chair from a shopping cart.

11.title: Riverfront House
11.plot: The Salvage Dawgs take on a Victorian house in Wellsville, OH. Key items salvaged include harlequin windows, corbels and front porch columns. Back at the shop, Mike and Tay build a wine rack from old brick molds.

12.title: Little Chef Dinner
12.plot: The Dawgs stay in Roanoke, VA, to salvage an old diner sign from Little Chef. The crew also picks through a huge warehouse in Greensboro, NC.

13.title: Roanoke Chamber of Commerce
13.plot: The Dawgs save pieces from the Roanoke Chamber of Commerce in VA, including safe deposit boxes and a pneumatic messaging system. The team also works on a large bar commissioned for the Natural Bridge Hotel.

1.title: St. Michael's Catholic School
1.plot: The team heads to St. Michael's Catholic School in Pittsburgh, PA, where they brave high-wire heights in order to save elements of the past. The guys also build a ladder console and discover a vintage army record player.

2.title: Greek Revival Farmhouse
2.plot: The team preserves a Greek revival farmhouse in Bentleyville, PA. They save mantles, tiles and a full-sized chicken coop. Then Mike and Tay build a freight cart couch in the Black Dog shop and a corn sheller gets Robert excited.

3.title: Vaughan Furniture Company
3.plot: The Dawgs head to the Vaughan Furniture Company in Galax, VA, where Mike and Ted struggle to salvage a heavy furniture press. Then Robert gets slowed down by explosion-proof lights and discovers a vintage TV and radio.

4.title: Pickle Mansion
4.plot: The Salvage Dawgs head to Knoxville, Tennessee, in hopes of salvaging the crumbling Pickle Mansion. They find a copper frieze and columns, then Mike discovers a fuel drop tank. Later he and Tay build a dresser kitchen island.

5.title: Mine Master's House
5.plot: The Dawgs travel to Quakertown, PA, to reclaim items from an old mine master's house. They find much of the house picked over, but Robert and Grayson struggle with flooring while Mike cuts structural beams out of the house.

6.title: Central Freewill House
6.plot: The Dawgs travel to Free Will House in Huntington, WV, where they salvage a bathtub, sitz bath and kitchen cabinets.

7.title: Rural Retreat Historical Society
7.plot: Mike, Robert and the team travel to the Rural Retreat Historical Society in Rural Retreat, Virginia. Mike sets up rigging from the rooftop for an outdoor clock while Robert salvages a vault door and bank teller station.

8.title: Grace Family Church
8.plot: The Dawgs travel to Vinton, Virginia, in order to salvage a massive piece of stained glass from the Grace Family Church, but they run into challenges when equipment is delayed.

9.title: Marion Bowling Alley
9.plot: The Salvage Dawgs travel to Marion, Virginia, to salvage a soon-to-be renovated bowling alley. However, the bowling alley floor turns out to be far heavier than they anticipated.

10.title: Texas Tavern Sign
10.plot: The Dawgs work at home in Roanoke, Virginia, where they salvage a sign for the Texas Tavern. Then the team heads to a warehouse in Philadelphia where they engage in fierce negotiations over bread molds and wine racks.

11.title: St. Agatha's Catholic Church
11.plot: The crew travels to snowy Ellwood City, Pennsylvania, to reclaim pieces of St. Agatha's Catholic Church. In the bitterly cold weather, they salvage stained glass, spiral ducting and lights.

12.title: Noland Company
12.plot: The Black Dog Salvage team works in Roanoke, Virginia, at the Noland Sign Company. On a windy day, they salvage metal lettering, copper cupolas and vintage plumbing.

13.title: St. Agatha's Church Rectory
13.plot: The Dawgs head back to snowy Ellwood City, Pennsylvania, to salvage the rectory of St. Agatha's Catholic Church. Robert, Mike and the crew brave snow and ice to salvage a triple sink, glass blocks and storm door.

1.title: Trinity Lutheran Church
1.plot: The Salvage Dawgs salvage an old church in Greencastle, PA, removing the windows, saving the large bell and executing an idea for a console.

2.title: Esther Ludwig Mansion
2.plot: The Salvage Dawgs head to Pennsylvania to save as much as they can from Esther Ludwig's mansion in Pennsylvania.

3.title: 19th Century Corncrib
3.plot: The Salvage Dawgs carefully deconstruct a corn crib in Hamburg, PA, and carefully document their process so they can reassemble it accurately.

4.title: Virginia Victorian Home
4.plot: The Salvage Dawgs travel to Hot Springs, VA, to salvage a late Victorian-style home's mantles, cabinets, sinks and round window.

5.title: Storybook Style House
5.plot: The Salvage Dawgs battle the heat and salvage unique chandeliers, sinks, windows and a Dutch door from a storybook-style home in Winston-Salem, NC.

6.title: Wayne Lanes Bowling Alley
6.plot: The Salvage Dawgs look for cool items at a bowling alley in Waynseboro, VA, including bowling balls, pins, shoes and whatever else they can find.

7.title: Return to Ludwig Mansion
7.plot: The Salvage Dawgs go back to the Ludwig mansion in Pennsylvania to pick up everything they left behind after their first salvage.

8.title: Park-n-Shop Grocery Store
8.plot: Mike takes the Black Dog Salvage crew to his hometown of Charlotte, NC, to salvage the signage left over from his very first job.

9.title: Lexington Burnout House
9.plot: The team goes to Lexington, VA, to see what they can save from a fire-damaged house that had recently been converted to apartments. Also, Robert and Mike get good news on an appraisal of a shuffleboard table from Greensboro, NC.

10.title: Beechcraft Airplane Salvage
10.plot: The Salvage Dawgs go over budget bidding on a 1947 Beechcraft airplane that requires professional help to be properly disassembled.

11.title: Victorian Free Classic House
11.plot: The team salvages a home in Hot Springs, VA, with great Eastlake hardware and Majorca tile, mantles and pocket doors. Mike makes a side table with floating shelves and Robert brings in old ceramic glove molds to sell in the store.

12.title: Burlington Wall Unit
12.plot: The teams visits Burlington, NC, to save an old apothecary unit from a 1930s pharmacy. Then Mike and Robert search for some new patterns for the shop in West Virginia, while Grayson builds a console.

13.title: Christiansburg House
13.plot: The team travels to Christiansburg, VA, to salvage the meat and potato elements from an old home.

1.title: Former United Methodist Church
1.plot: The Salvage Dawgs head to Laurel, DE, to salvage what they can from a former Methodist church that fell victim to water damage. The team removes pews and a skylight before heading back to the shop to work on a beam console.

2.title: Peanut Silo Salvage
2.plot: The Salvage Dawgs hesitantly take on a Peanut Silo Salvage in Skippers, VA. After a rather precarious roof removal, they devise a different plan to dismantle the silos while keeping them intact.

3.title: Lerner House
3.plot: The crew travels to Orange, VA, to salvage archways, columns and windows from a 1930s brick mansion. Then, Mike and Robert return General George C. Marshall's door to the Virginia Military Institute.

4.title: Peacock Salem Laundry
4.plot: The Dawgs stay close to home to salvage the old Salem Peacock Cleaners in Salem, Virginia. Over 100 years old, the building is filled with antique laundromat parts including a fur fumigator door, a steam press and soapstone sink.

5.title: Teacherage
5.plot: The Dawgs head to Henderson, NC, to salvage doors, archways, columns and a fire escape from an old home that used to house young female teachers.

6.title: Pinehurst Steam Plant
6.plot: The Dawgs go to Pinehurst, NC, to salvage an old transom, cool valves and more from an old steam plant that used to run the town.

7.title: Return to Delaware
7.plot: The Dawgs face cold winter weather as they attempt to salvage as much as possible from an old church in Laurel, DE. The team works together to remove large stained glass and get it back to the store with minimal damage.

8.title: Former Dixie Furniture Plant
8.plot: The team travels to a vacant furniture plant in Lexington, NC, where they work in near-darkness salvaging conveyor belts, fire doors, veneer molds, factory carts and industrial lights.

9.title: Navy SEAL Boat
9.plot: The Salvage Dawgs travel to a shipyard in Norfolk, VA, to salvage a boat once used for Navy SEAL insertions. They salvage some key items, but their energy and patience is tested once they realize the boat won't fit on the trailer.

10.title: Cosby Brothers Mill
10.plot: The crew heads to Cosby Brothers Mill in Grottoes, VA, where they hope to salvage old parts if they can get them down from the third story. Then, Mike and Robert go up the road to see what they can do with an old, repurposed barn.

11.title: Parkville Farm House
11.plot: The team heads to Parkville, MD, to salvage a classic farmhouse. They remove steel from the outside and radiators, banisters and wainscoting from the inside. Afterward, Mike rewards the Dawgs with indoor skydiving!

12.title: C&O Railway
12.plot: The team travels to Clifton Forge, Virginia, to conquer C&O Railway's steam engine repair plant. Using force and a lot of tools, they work to save unique pieces like railway bases and corrugated glass.

13.title: Splitting Up Jobs
13.plot: Robert sends Tay and Grayson to salvage on their own in Salem, Virginia, while Mike and Ted travel to Norfolk, VA, to pick up a special nautical structure for a client. The Dawgs come together in the end to finish the salvage.

imdb.title: Salvage Dawgs
plot: Entertaining show about saving beautiful old doors, stained glass, floors, mantels, etc. from buildings that are slated to be torn down. The crew works hard to ensure future generations can enjoy the wonderful craftsmanship of the past.::spookyjean52
